csic.iiia.ftl.base.utils
Class PrefuseJScrollPane.DisplayPaintListener

java.lang.Object
  csic.iiia.ftl.base.utils.PrefuseJScrollPane.DisplayPaintListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, prefuse.util.display.PaintListener
Enclosing class:
PrefuseJScrollPane
public class PrefuseJScrollPane.DisplayPaintListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements prefuse.util.display.PaintListener

The DisplayPaintListener has the intend to notify the scollpane when the content is repainted. Since there seems to be no true solution to get informed about scale changes or movement this might be a long living work around. If someone finds a better solution feel free to change the notification method.

My first attempt was creating a control that notifies me on all mouse actions but that didn't catch automated zooms, so I tied a control with a timer that checks if transformations or scaling changed.
Now I have combined the timer idea with the repainting, letÂ´s see if it works better.

Author:
marcus staender
